TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DesignerActionPropertyItem extends System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem
Public NotInheritable Class DesignerActionPropertyItem Inherits DesignerActionItem

Docs.summary: Represents a panel item that is associated with a property in a class derived from . This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionPropertyItem> class represents individual items in a smart tag panel. Each item is typically associated with a property in a class that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class and supplied by the component author. The association is maintained through the name of the property, as stored in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionPropertyItem.MemberName%2A> property.
Individual panel items are associated together to form a panel by a call to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class.
To display the value of the associated property, that property must have a `get` accessor method; to allow editing, the property must have a `set` accessor method. The way in which the panel allows direct editing of a property item by the user depends on the supporting type information present for the data type of the associated property. The following table shows the likely scheme.
|Property type information|Property item editing user interface (UI)| |-------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------| |Has an associated type editor (<xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor>)|The type editor associated with the underlying property is displayed for editing the property's value.| |Has an associated type converter to a known type (<xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter>)|The type editor for the known type is displayed for editing the property's value. For example, a type converter to <xref:System.String> will likely display a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.| |Boolean value|The item is displayed using a binary UI, such as a check mark.| |None of the above.|The item is displayed as a non-editable text string using the data type's <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> method.|
All fundamental types, such as <xref:System.Boolean?displayProperty=nameWithType>, and common [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] data types, such as <xref:System.String?displayProperty=nameWithType>, supply standard type converters and editors. For more information about type converters, see [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)) or [Generalized Type Conversion](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/49253ae6-7657-4810-82ab-1176a6feeada). For more information about type editors, see [How to: Implement a UI Type Editor](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ed961fb9-ee02-4666-b511-05f3204bb75c).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a collection of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem> objects. For a full example of implementing smart tags, see [How to: Attach Smart Tags to a Windows Forms Component](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/42cc4a0c-9ab3-47e1-93b8-03b6a6ccf233).

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionPropertyItem.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.String%29> constructor sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Category%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Description%2A> properties to `null`.
The `memberName` parameter refers to the name of the associated property that is a member of the programmer-supplied class derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class.

## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionPropertyItem.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.String%29> constructor sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.Description%2A> property to `null`.
For more information about how the `category` parameter is used to group items on a panel, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method.
The `memberName` parameter refers to the name of the associated property that is a member of the programmer-supplied class derived from <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList>.

## Remarks For more information about how the `category` parameter is used to group items on a panel, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.GetSortedActionItems%2A> method.
The `memberName` parameter refers to the name of the associated property that is a member of the programmer-supplied class derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a collection of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem> objects. For a full example of implementing smart tags, see [How to: Attach Smart Tags to a Windows Forms Component](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/42cc4a0c-9ab3-47e1-93b8-03b6a6ccf233).

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the property that this item is associated with.
Docs.value: A that contains the name of the associated property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionPropertyItem.MemberName%2A> property specifies which property - in the class derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class - the item should be bound to. When the programmer interacts with the panel item through the user interface (UI), this associated property will be set.
<xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionPropertyItem.MemberName%2A> is set in the constructor. Its value is case-sensitive.

Docs.related: Designer Commands and the DesignerAction Object Model for Windows Forms

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a component that contributes its items to the current panel.
Docs.value: The contributing component, which should have an associated designer that supplies objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks With the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionPropertyItem.RelatedComponent%2A> property, another component can lend its pull-model panel items to the current list. For example, a user control might aggregate the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem> objects from one or more of its constituent controls.
This property works in conjunction with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem.AllowAssociate%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property.

Docs.related: Designer Commands and the DesignerAction Object Model for Windows Forms
